Dear Mr. Gloss:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4505 Plans and specifications.
Section (1) Plans and specifications shall be submitted to the bureau
Description of fire services for review and approval prior to any
remodeling in an institution, or the construction or
conversion of a structure for use as an institution.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Program began construction on a kitchen remodel prior to
receiving an approval on Plan Review from the Bureau of Fire
Services.
Investigation The facility informed DCWL of its intention to remodel the kitchen
as early as March 2023. On 03/23/2023 Consultant discussed
with Chief Administrator and Licensee Designee and it was
clearly stated that the Plan Review process would need to be
followed prior to the beginning of any construction. On
07/10/2023 the website where facilities can submit Plan Review
1

submissions electronically was shared with the Chief
Administrator.
During an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility on
10/04/2023 Consultant observed construction was underway to
remodel the kitchen of the facility.
On 10/24/2023 documentation from the Bureau of Fire Services
was received confirming the Plan Review submission for this
building construction was denied, and details were provided to the
facility on how to move forward with any Plan Review
submissions.
Analysis Through observation of the facility and documentation reviewed it
was found that the program began construction prior to receiving
the approval for the project from the Bureau of Fire Services as
required.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
